issues.description: The solutionâ€™s Milkable interface and its implementations define messageOnMilk with a double volume parameter, but the problem specification and UML diagram require messageOnMilk() without parameters. This mismatch will confuse students about the correct method signature and break the expected song and milking tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the Milkable interface to declare messageOnMilk() with no parameters, and update all implementing classes (Seal, Goat) to remove the volume parameter and return the milked string without volume.
